public_information: There is a finite set of objects named object_0 through object_12 with relations cats, hand, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect and next and a binary relation vase used by actions.

Available actions and their preconditions and effects are as follows: paltry requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2; paltry adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1.
sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2; sip adds vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2.
clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2; clip adds vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2.

wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3; wretched adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1.
memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1; memory adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1.
tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1; tightfisted adds next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1.
All actions are parameterized over object identifiers and manipulate relations over those objects.
The environment provides two distinct initial problem snapshots and goals reported separately by different observers as partial perspectives.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analysis agent. Read the public action schemata and your private observed facts and plan fragment. Produce a structured summary of which actions in the public schema are applicable to your facts, list the preconditions that are satisfied and unsatisfied for candidate actions, identify which relations are most relevant to reach the goal next object_12 object_11, and emit any ambiguous object name mappings and missing information that would be needed for full planning. Output must be a compact machine-readable summary and not raw PDDL.

You are an analysis agent. Read the public action schemata and your private observed facts. Produce a structured summary of which actions in the public schema are applicable to your facts, list the preconditions that are satisfied and unsatisfied for candidate actions, identify paths that could achieve the goals next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5, and emit any ambiguous object name mappings and missing information that would be needed for full planning. Output must be a compact machine-readable summary and not raw PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL production targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Receive structured analyses from multiple agents, reconcile differing object names and partial initial states, and produce one complete PDDL domain file and one PDDL problem file that integrate the public action schemata and the combined initial facts as consistently as possible. Keep agent actions distinct only if their semantics require distinction. Use syntax compatible with FastDownwards and include any required :requirements. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL should aim to enable FastDownwards to attempt to reach the stated goals next object_12 object_11, next object_11 object_7, and next object_12 object_5 where feasible given the reconciled initial facts.
